title: 112_hr3813
content: The Act titled "Securing Annuities for Federal Employees Act of 2012" mandates retirement contributions. The "Securing Annuities for Federal Employees Act of 2012" mandates changes to the Civil Service Retirement System, including adjustments to individual contributions based on calendar years. The "Securing Annuities for Federal Employees Act of 2012" mandates changes to the Civil Service Retirement System, including adjustments to individual contributions based on calendar years. Government contributions under Section 8334(a)(1)(B) of title 5, United States Code, are amended to specify the amount to be contributed for periods after December 31, 2012. The Federal Employees' Retirement System is amended to adjust contributions based on calendar years, with an additional 0.5 percentage point for periods in 2013, 2014, or 2015. The Federal Employees' Retirement System is amended to adjust contributions based on calendar years, with an additional 0.5 percentage point for periods in 2013, 2014, or 2015. For calendar years after 2015, the applicable percentage will be equal to that of 2015. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS RELATING TO SECURE ANNUITY EMPLOYEES. The definition of a secure annuity employee is clarified as an employee or Member who first becomes subject to the chapter after December 31, 2012, and does not have at least 5 years of civilian service creditable under a retirement system for Government employees. Individual contributions are further amended in relation to secure annuity employees. The United States Code is amended to specify the applicable percentage for secure annuity employees, with different rates for various categories of employees. The United States Code is amended to specify the applicable percentage for secure annuity employees, with different rates for various categories of employees. The average pay and computation of basic annuity for certain employees are also revised. The annuity for employees retiring under this subchapter is calculated based on their average pay and total service, with different rates for secure annuity employees. Members or former Members with title to a Member annuity have their annuity computed similarly, with adjustments for years of service. The annuity calculation for Congressional employees and Members retiring under this subchapter is based on their average pay and years of service, with adjustments for different types of service. The annuity calculation for Congressional employees and Members retiring under this subchapter is based on their average pay and years of service, with adjustments for different types of service, not exceeding a total of 20 years. The annuity calculation for air traffic controllers retiring under section 8412(a) is based on their average pay and years of service, with adjustments for different types of service, not exceeding a total of 20 years. The annuity calculation for air traffic controllers retiring under section 8412(a) is based on their average pay and years of service, with adjustments for different types of service. For non-secure annuity employees, the calculation is 1.7 percent of average pay multiplied by years of service, while for secure annuity employees, it is 1.4 percent of average pay multiplied by years of service. Amendments are made to subsection (h) regarding the annuity calculation process. Amendments are made to subsection (h) regarding the annuity calculation process for air traffic controllers retiring under section 8412(a), changing the term "protection officer" to "customs and border protection officer, or secure annuity employee." SEC. 4. ANNUITY SUPPLEMENT. Amendments to title 5, United States Code, state that no annuity supplement shall be paid to individuals whose annuity is based on separation after December 31, 2012, except for specific cases under subsections (d) or (e) of section 8412. SEC. 5. CONTRIBUTIONS TO THRIFT SAVINGS FUND OF PAYMENTS FOR ACCRUED OR ACCUMULATED LEAVE. Amendments to title 5, United States Code allow employees and Members to contribute to the Thrift Savings Fund from their basic pay or payments for accrued leave. The amendments also include provisions for employees of the United States Postal Service or the Postal Regulatory Commission. Amendments to title 5, United States Code allow employees and Members to contribute to the Thrift Savings Fund from their basic pay or payments for accrued leave. Contributions can be made in any pay period and through direct transfer of payments for accumulated leave. Amendments to title 5, United States Code allow employees and Members to contribute to the Thrift Savings Fund from their basic pay or payments for accrued leave. Contributions can be made in any pay period and through direct transfer of payments for accumulated leave. The Executive Director of the Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board will promulgate regulations to implement these changes, with the amendments taking effect one year after enactment or an earlier date determined by the Executive Director. SEC. 6. COORDINATION WITH OTHER RETIREMENT SYSTEMS. Foreign Service Retirement System and the Federal Employees' Retirement System must maintain conformity with existing provisions of law. The Civil Service Retirement System must also maintain conformity with the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System. The Federal Employees' Retirement System applies to employees of the Central Intelligence Agency. The Tennessee Valley Authority Act of 1933 is amended to allow the chief executive officer to prescribe regulations for the Securing Annuities for Federal Employees Act of 2012 for employees of the Tennessee Valley Authority.
